elements.title: Chopin's heart (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chopin's heart (composer pictured) was smuggled into Poland by his sister?

elements.title: All Saints Church, Shanghai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shen Zigao, the first Anglican bishop of Chinese descent, was consecrated at All Saints Church, Shanghai, in 1934?

elements.title: Al Treml (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before filming National Football League games, former Green Bay Packers video director Al Treml was trained in photography while serving in the United States Army?

elements.title: Global Engagement Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Russian propaganda outlet Sputnik compared the Global Engagement Center to the Ministry of Truth in George Orwell's Nineteen Eighty-Four?

elements.title: Giovanni Bonfanti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Giovanni Bonfanti scored a goal on his debut in a European competition?

elements.title: a statue of Queen Victoria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The New Zealand Herald opposed a children's hospital in favour of a statue of Queen Victoria?

elements.title: Hank Aaron State Trail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Hank Aaron State Trail was regularly visited by Hank Aaron until his death in 2021?

elements.title: exist (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that it is controversial whether there are things that do not exist?
